<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_run:
```c
int metal_run(int threads, metal_thread_t child, void *arg)
{
	pthread_t tids[threads];
	int error, ts_created;

	error = metal_run_noblock(threads, child, arg, tids, &ts_created);

	metal_finish_threads(ts_created, (void *)tids);

	return error;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function metal_run:
int metal_run_noblock(int threads, metal_thread_t child,
		     void *arg, void *tids, int *threads_out)
{
	int error, i;
	pthread_t *tid_p = (pthread_t *)tids;

	if (!tids) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "invalid argument, tids is NULL.\n");
		return -EINVAL;
	}

	error = 0;
	for (i = 0; i < threads; i++) {
		error = -pthread_create(&tid_p[i], NULL, child, arg);
		if (error) {
			metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "failed to create thread - %s\n",
				  strerror(error));
			break;
		}
	}

	*threads_out = i;
	return error;
}
...
void metal_finish_threads(int threads, void *tids)
{
	int i;
	pthread_t *tid_p = (pthread_t *)tids;

	if (!tids) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "invalid argument, tids is NULL.\n");
		return;
	}

	for (i = 0; i < threads; i++)
		(void)pthread_join(tid_p[i], NULL);
}
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
(void)pthread_join(tid_p[i], NULL);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation in the shown fragment: a call to pthread_join does not itself call metal_finish_threads or metal_run, so there is no direct or indirect recursion indicated by the fragment. A possible violation scenario would be if the thread start routine (child) called metal_finish_threads (directly or transitively) while metal_finish_threads is waiting in pthread_join, creating an indirect recursive call chain (metal_finish_threads -> pthread_join -> child -> metal_finish_threads), which would violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2.
